page.title: 06BOLE HILL QUARRY,WINGERWORTH
page.content: {Bole Hill Quarry}was working before The Great War. It now occupies a 12 acre site and is owned by Mr Gregory, who employs 50 people. The quarry works throughout the year and produces, on average, 30 tonnes of stone a day. These are the 5 types of stone: Stancliffe, Stanton, Dumphries, Lacomby, and Limestone. At{Bole Hill}there are 2 polishers, 10 saws, various hand tools, forklift trucks and a lathe. This machinery is not expensive to keep but it needs regular oil changing and maintenance. Stone is sent from{Bole Hill}all over the world, but mostly to Scotland and the Midlands. It is used for restoration work, arches, walls, fire- places and carvings.
